text:
Cicero District 99
Cicero District 99
Dear Cicero District 99 Community,
On Wednesday, Oct. 30, the Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE) released its2024 ILLINOIS REPORT CARD
This annual report provides a comprehensive look at each school's progress in academics, student success, school culture and climate, and financial investments.
District 99 is proud of our students' growth and continues to analyze ways to enhance learning outcomes for all.
One key feature of the report card is the annual summative designation â€” a federally required descriptor based on eight indicators of academic performance that shows how well each Illinois school meets the needs of its students.
We are pleased to report that in the 2024 Report Card, 11 schools received the commendable designation from ISBE. To earn this designation, schools must not have any student groups underperforming below the â€œall studentsâ€ group of the lowest-performing 5 percent of schools, and performance must not rank in the top 10 percent statewide.
Cicero District 99 schools with the commendable designation for the 2023-2024 school year include:
ğŸ¦ Abraham Lincoln Elementary School (PK-6)
ğŸº Cicero East Elementary School (4-6)
ğŸ¦… Cicero West Elementary School (PK-3)
ğŸ´ Columbus East Elementary School (4-6)
ğŸ± Columbus West Elementary School (PK-3)
ğŸ¾ Daniel Burnham Elementary School (K-2)
ğŸ±ğŸ‘¤ Drexel Elementary School (K-6)
ğŸŠ Goodwin Elementary School (PK-6)
ğŸ¦… Liberty Elementary School (PK-3)
ğŸ¦ˆ Sherlock Elementary School (PK-6)
ğŸ¯ Unity Junior High School (7-8)
Three Cicero District 99 schools received the â€œtargeted supportâ€ designation, which applies when a school performs well overall but has one student group performing at or below the â€œall studentsâ€ group of the lowest-performing 5 percent of schools. Targeted schools receive a federal grant and participate in a four-year improvement cycle. The following schools received this designation for the 2023-2024 year:
ğŸ¦ Theodore Roosevelt Elementary School (3-6)
ğŸº Warren Park Elementary School (PK-6)
ğŸ² Woodrow Wilson Elementary School (K-6)
The ISBE Report Card also highlights District gains in both reading and math, reflecting investments in Strategic Plan goals, including the shift to structured literacy focused on foundational reading, enhanced math instruction, and robust teacher support through professional development.
Chronic absenteeism remains a focus area for improvement. By increasing attendance across all grade levels and student groups, District 99 can improve its overall designations districtwide, ensuring students maximize daily learning opportunities.
â€œOur teachers and staff are incredibly hardworking, and we are proud of our students, staff and community as we move forward together to improve student outcomes,â€ said Dr. Aldo Calderin, superintendent. â€œFor sustained improvements, we need our students present each day in our schools.â€
To view the complete Illinois Report Card for Cicero District 99 CLICK HERE
Stay involved with your childâ€™s learning and activities at school.
